1.verse: Salutation - Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, To Philemon our dear friend and co-worker,

2.verse: to Apphia our sister, to Archippus our fellow-soldier, and to the church in your house:

3.verse: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

4.verse: Philemon’s Love and Faith - When I remember you in my prayers, I always thank my God

5.verse: because I hear of your love for all the saints and your faith towards the Lord Jesus.

6.verse: I pray that the sharing of your faith may become effective when you perceive all the good that we may do for Christ.

7.verse: I have indeed received much joy and encouragement from your love, because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed through you, my brother.

8.verse: Paul’s Plea for Onesimus - For this reason, though I am bold enough in Christ to command you to do your duty,

9.verse: yet I would rather appeal to you on the basis of love—and I, Paul, do this as an old man, and now also as a prisoner of Christ Jesus.

10.verse: I am appealing to you for my child, Onesimus, whose father I have become during my imprisonment.

11.verse: Formerly he was useless to you, but now he is indeed useful both to you and to me.

12.verse: I am sending him, that is, my own heart, back to you.

13.verse: I wanted to keep him with me, so that he might be of service to me in your place during my imprisonment for the gospel;

14.verse: but I preferred to do nothing without your consent, in order that your good deed might be voluntary and not something forced.

15.verse: Perhaps this is the reason he was separated from you for a while, so that you might have him back for ever,

16.verse: no longer as a slave but as more than a slave, a beloved brother—especially to me but how much more to you, both in the flesh and in the Lord.

17.verse: So if you consider me your partner, welcome him as you would welcome me.

18.verse: If he has wronged you in any way, or owes you anything, charge that to my account.

19.verse: I, Paul, am writing this with my own hand: I will repay it. I say nothing about your owing me even your own self.

20.verse: Yes, brother, let me have this benefit from you in the Lord! Refresh my heart in Christ.

21.verse: Confident of your obedience, I am writing to you, knowing that you will do even more than I say.

22.verse: One thing more—prepare a guest room for me, for I am hoping through your prayers to be restored to you.

23.verse: Final Greetings and Benediction - Epaphras, my fellow-prisoner in Christ Jesus, sends greetings to you,

24.verse: and so do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my fellow-workers.

25.verse: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
